subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.0 IDE support
msgSnippet: Excellent idea.  If anyone has an inside connection to ant, let me know. David Saff
messageBody:
Excellent idea. If anyone has an "inside connection" to ant, let me know.

David Saff

Ben Maurer wrote:
> David,
>
> Is there any chance you could try talking with the ant folks about
> "level 1" support for junit4 in there? I was actually going to do it,
> but it'd probably be better for somebody with more knowledge of what
> is involved to take on the task.
>
> -- Ben
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> >
> > Marcy,
> >
> > There's three possible levels of support:
> >
> > 1) JUnit 4 tests run natively, just like JUnit 3 tests. This will
> > happen in Eclipse 3.2 M6, to be released March 31. It was intended for
> > the Feb. 17 release, but there were legal surprises. Sigh.
> >
> > 2) JUnit 4 tests run, with full display, using the compatibility
> layer.
> > This works in all versions of Eclipse since 3.1. Just add to a JUnit 4
> > test class or suite:
> >
> > public static Test suite() {
> > return new JUnit4Adapter(ThisClass.class);
> > }
> >
> > To enable this. This is how the JUnit developers have been running our
> > tests most of the time, and it works very well.
> >
> > 3) JUnit 4 tests run, with partial display, using the compatibility
> > layer. This, to the best of my knowledge, is the state of the art in
> > other IDE's. The tests run, and failures are indicated, but test
> counts
> > and names may be missing.
> >
> > I'm trying to start conversations with some of the other IDE developers
> > about support, but since my fork was already in the Eclipse pie, the
> > most has happened there, to my knowledge.
> >
> > David Saff
> >
> > Marcy Spector wrote:
> > > Which IDEs are supported with the latest JUnit 4.0, and is there any
> > > supporting documentation?
> > >
> > >
> > > ---------------------------------
> > > Yahoo! Mail
> > > Use Photomail to share photos without annoying attachments.
